reviews.sentence: Beautiful hotel in perfect location. The hotel was even nicer than I expected. Everything you could possibly want was within walking distance and the hotel itself was absolutely gorgeous with great views too. The pool was a little small but the hot tub eateries rooms views and staff were all spectacular.

Nice hotel. The hotel itself is lovely and the rooms are nice. There are a number of places to eat in the hotel lobby which is convenient. A quick walk outside brings you to more places to eat and a mall is also very close by. Comfortable beds tv is a great size very nice staff. The parking. I did not like that as a guest at the hotel I was still expected to pay full price for use of the garage.
The rooms were spacious the beds very comfortable and most of the employees were very nice.

Great Place To Stay. This is an awesome place to stay. The hotel is close to everything you could want andor need. I was a bit doubtful about staying downtown but this was the best decision ever. The parking was a bit expensive but I was prepared for the cost given that it was mentioned on the website. The rooms were spacious clean and quiet. The hotel staff was professional and friendly. The valet team was the best and offered great recommendations on things to do in the area. I am thinking of visiting again in the next couple of months and will definitely book here. The hotel staff was amazing. Dalton is a great representation of how customer service should be done. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. The location is good with plenty of things to do within walking distance. Shopping museums and restaurants all at your door step.
Nice people and nice place but the room was very small. They put an incident hold charge on your card that is half the price of the room.

Great location. OK stay. This was my 2nd stay at this property. The first time was much better. This time I thought the housekeeping team was really lacking. A posted note stated that due to conservation sheets would not be changed every day but would be on the second day. Mine were never changed and I was there 4 nights. I know this because of a mascara stain on the fitted sheet that was there every night. By the time I saw it at night I was ready for bed and not willing to get re dressed for housekeeping to come change the linens. I saw a housekeeper on the morning on my 3rd day and she said they would be changed. NOPE. Same stain on the sheet. It was now Thanksgiving and I think most of the staff was sent home. The bathroom counter was not even wiped down that day. The room was VERY dusty. Stains could be seen on the wallpaper in the bathroom and the bedroom area. Refrigerator in the cabinet was not installed properly and wobbled any time the cabinet was opened. Location perfect to get anywhere in the city. Starbucks TVs in the lobby are great. View from revolving bar restaurant on the top floor is awesome Location is the prime reason I stayed here. The skywalk to the mall restaurants and other hotels is SO convenient. Housekeeping could do a better job. Sheets have stains. Towels are very worn. some have pulls and holes. Room needs to be maintained better.

Great nye party. Nye buffet package. Well worth the money. Clean beautiful room. Delicious food at the fat rosterfriendly staff. Half hour check in wait and long wait for elevator during party its only complaint. Overall amazing stay.
Very nice hotel. Loved the view and the connection to the indoor mall was so much fun.
Everyone was great. The rooms are clean and beds comfortable.
Exceptional. Room and food was great.
Called lost and found left pants in closet. No call back as was told.

Disappointing. The location is nice and some of the staff was very helpful. Specially John. He helped us get our bags ready when we had to move rooms. They are currently doing construction and renovating some of the rooms but they do not tell you that when you are checking in. So if you think you can sleep in you are wrong. Lol8am on a Saturday they are hammering every inch of every wall. And just when I thought maybe Sunday it would be better since it ’s the Lords day and maybe the construction guys will have the day off. No. They brought drills this time. You ’d think you are in the same room as them. That ’s how loud it was. When I called the front desk the guy said to me “ well we are lucky they started at 9 bc they wanted to start at 8. But check out is in just 3 hours so I do n’t think you want to move rooms because there ’s no point ”. for the 300 you charge for 2 nights you better move me to another room right now and I ’m getting my three hours of sleep. Overall it was n’t that great of an experience not for that kind of money.
Little disappointed. The location of the hotel was in walking distance of the convention center. Rooms could use some upgrades. Plumbing in the shower was slow.
Little disappointed. The location of the hotel was in walking distance of the convention center. Rooms could use some upgrades. Plumbing in the shower was slow.

Cleanliness of room was less than expected and for the price deteriated room needs some work. Our waitress at the Eagles Nest was very good. Service was slow but she had several tables that were very needy beyond necessity more than likely due to alcohol. And one table the guy dumped the girl and left. So our waitress had to deal with some things beyond her control. She really appreciated our patience and understanding.

Currently staying here for the ATA show. The rooms are terrible. The linens are super thin literally paper then the walls are the same the decor is old. The walls are so thin we can hear the people in the room next to us snoring. We will never stay again. We will be trying to get our money back and switching hotels. Again this was by far our worst experience in a hotel. I do not recommend this place.

Disappointed I expected so much more at a Hyat. I typically stay at a Hyat property only once a year. More often I stay in lodging that is perhaps a tier below the typical Hyat. So I expected a lot more this time while staying at the Hyat. My experience was a tremendous disappointment. I was not able to control the temperature in my room I asked for foam pillows but received feather or feather like pillows and the humidifier I requested was filthy. About the only thing that was better than expected was the valet service. Perhaps the worst aspects are that the shower faucet did not work properly and it was nearly impossible to control the water temperature. In addition this is an atrium style hotel and there were guests screaming as they came in at 4 am from partying. The echoes likely woke anyone who was sleeping. Where was the doorman or securityBe forewarned. The location is central to downtown Indianapolis but you may get more or less than you bargained for.

Best Birthday Valentines. The absolute BEST hospitality I have had ever. I enjoyed everything this trip was more for my partner than myself and she enjoyed everything. Checking in was such a breeze and they allowed me enough time to come and decorate the room before I needed to go pick up my partner. They even brought up a slice of cake for her birthday which she loved. Everyone was so helpful before during and concluding my stay. Having dinner at the Eagles Nest was the best with the freezing temp outside not having to leave the hotel was GREAT. I certainly will stay here again and recommend this place to anyone who may need a suggestion. My partner and I agreed this time spent was amazing. I want to thank ALL that helped but Michael Angelo the Valet and anyone else that helped make this an amazing experience for my partner and I.

Pool was cold heater not working. Hot tub not 104 degrees and no actuation of the Jets. Everything using the hot tub kids too and the filtration could not keep up. Room not cleaned. Orange juice in the coffee maker. Water from the tap was white not clear. Room not ready over an hour after check in time. Decor is more business not comfortable or romantic. Fire alarm went off and we were told to stay in our rooms. Not a good impression for a Downtown Hotel. 2 star at best the night I stayed.

I stayed this past weekend Feb 28March1. my experience was not great. Someone broke into our hotel room while we were gone to our event. When I approached the front desk about it the lady stated she does n’t know who entered no help at all. Being that it was almost midnight instead of driving back home they moved us to another floor. We get up there and two rooms down it ’s a bunch of teens having a party. I did n’t want to ruin their fun but after 2 hours I asked security to ask them to take their music and friends from in front of my door. DIDN’T HAPPENED. They partied until 3 in the morning. The morning manager offered us free breakfast and Starbucks. Oh and then a small discount because we used Valet. Needless to say I will not return to this hotel EVER again. SleplesNight.
